key_responsibilities: assisting the communications director with press releases and press inquiries
requirements: experience or education in digital media, new media or journalism
ability to boil down complex issues into easily understandable social media content
self-starter with the ability to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment
ability and interest in learning to create graphics and edit video

key_responsibilities: ensuring that constituent correspondence is responded to in a timely manner
assisting the Communications Director with press-related materials, research, daily news clips, and media tracking
working with local and national reporters, producers, and bookers
drafting press releases, op-eds, and speeches
overseeing an active social media, online operation, and email communications program
requirements: close partnership with legislative and district staff
ability to work well under pressure
ability to work well in a team environment

key_responsibilities: assisting constituents by navigating complex casework through federal agencies in areas such as veterans’ affairs, social security, housing, immigration
assessing casework and community activities for matters warranting legislative action
requirements: excellent written and oral communication skills
comfortable working both independently and as part of a team
prior experience working for federal, state, or local government
fluency or strong verbal and written proficiency in Spanish
strong knowledge or connection with Riverside County and California’s 36th Congressional District
availability for evening and weekend assignments

key_responsibilities: planning and executing a proactive and aggressive media and community outreach strategy
drafting press releases and advisories, op-eds, and talking points
implementing a strategic social media outreach
requirements: able to work well in a fast-paced collaborative environment
ability to draft all forms of communications materials—especially op-eds—and an ability to respond to challenging situations quickly and strategically
track-record of successfully pitching both national and local media entities
existing relationships with DC reporters and producers

key_responsibilities: handling a diverse portfolio of issues including science, technology, education, energy, and agriculture
handling multiple projects simultaneously in a demanding office environment
requirements: superior written and oral communications skills
prior Capitol Hill experience either as a Legislative Correspondent or Legislative Assistant

key_responsibilities: coordinating and maintaining the Member’s schedule
requirements: able to juggle multiple tasks with competing priorities

key_responsibilities: coordinating White House and Capitol tours
requirements: excellent written, verbal, research, and organizational skills
ability to juggle multiple tasks with competing priorities
experience using SPRY Mail constituent management system

key_responsibilities: handling health and aging policy portfolio
preparing and staffing the Member for committee hearings and floor votes
developing and advancing legislation and other policy priorities of the Member
requirements: strong written and oral communication skills
knowledge of the Affordable Care Act, Medicare, Medicaid, and the legislative process
